title: Matthew Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Matthew with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 28 chapters.

questions.question: Who is described as the son of David and the son of Abraham in the genealogy of Jesus?
questions.explanation: Matthew 1:1 states that Jesus Christ is the son of David, the son of Abraham.

questions.question: According to Matthew 1, how many generations are there from Abraham to David?
questions.explanation: Matthew 1:17 states there are fourteen generations from Abraham to David.

questions.question: Who appeared to Joseph in a dream to tell him not to fear taking Mary as his wife?
questions.explanation: Matthew 1:20 records that an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream.

questions.question: What name was Joseph told to give to Mary's son because he shall save his people from their sins?
questions.explanation: Matthew 1:21 states the child shall be called Jesus because he shall save his people from their sins.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Judge not, that ye be not ______.'
questions.explanation: Matthew 7:1 teaches not to judge others so that you will not be judged yourself.

questions.question: According to Matthew 7, how shall men be judged if they judge others?
questions.explanation: Matthew 7:2 says with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged.

questions.question: True or False: Matthew 7 teaches that a good tree can bring forth evil fruit.
questions.explanation: Matthew 7:18 states a good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit.

questions.question: In the parable of the sower, what happened to the seeds that fell upon stony places?
options: They sprang up quickly but withered because they had no root
They grew strong and bore fruit
questions.correctAnswer: They sprang up quickly but withered because they had no root
questions.explanation: Matthew 13:5-6 explains the seeds on stony places sprang up quickly but withered due to no root.

questions.question: What does the seed sown on good ground represent in the parable of the sower?
options: The word of the kingdom heard and understood
questions.correctAnswer: The word of the kingdom heard and understood
questions.explanation: Matthew 13:23 says the good ground represents those who hear and understand the word and bear fruit.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The kingdom of heaven is like unto a grain of ______ seed, which a man took, and sowed in his field.'
questions.explanation: Matthew 13:31 compares the kingdom of heaven to a mustard seed.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus taught the multitudes only in direct statements, never in parables.
questions.explanation: Matthew 13:34 states Jesus spoke all things in parables to the multitude.

questions.question: Who asked Jesus, 'Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife for every cause?'
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:3 records the Pharisees asking Jesus about divorce.

questions.question: According to Jesus in Matthew 19, from the beginning, God made them male and female for what purpose?
options: To leave father and mother and cleave to wife
questions.correctAnswer: To leave father and mother and cleave to wife
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:4-5 explains God made male and female to leave parents and cleave to spouse.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:24 states this comparison about the difficulty for the rich to enter the kingdom.

questions.question: What did Jesus say to the rich young man who asked how to have eternal life?
options: Sell all and give to the poor
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:16-17 records Jesus telling the young man to keep the commandments.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I ______ them.'
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:20 promises Jesus's presence where two or three are gathered in His name.

questions.question: Who did Jesus say is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:4 says whoever humbles himself as a little child is greatest in the kingdom.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus taught that it was lawful to divorce a wife for any cause.
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:6-9 clarifies that divorce was not lawful except for fornication.

questions.question: In Matthew 5, which group did Jesus say are blessed because theirs is the kingdom of heaven?
questions.explanation: Matthew 5:3 states, 'Blessed are the poor in spirit: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.'

questions.question: What did Jesus say about anger in Matthew 5?
options: It is as bad as murder
It is acceptable in some cases
It is good for the soul
questions.correctAnswer: It is as bad as murder
questions.explanation: Matthew 5:21-22 equates anger without cause to the sin of murder.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said, 'Ye are the salt of the earth.'
questions.explanation: Matthew 5:13 contains Jesus's teaching that his followers are the salt of the earth.

questions.question: According to Matthew 6, what does Jesus instruct to do in secret, so your Father who sees in secret will reward you?
questions.explanation: Matthew 6:1-4 instructs giving alms in secret for heavenly reward.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'But lay up for yourselves treasures in ______, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt.'
questions.explanation: Matthew 6:20 teaches to store treasures in heaven, not on earth.

questions.question: What instruction does Jesus give about worrying in Matthew 6?
options: Take no thought for your life
questions.correctAnswer: Take no thought for your life
questions.explanation: Matthew 6:25 tells not to be anxious about life or what to eat or drink.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus commands to forgive others so that your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
questions.explanation: Matthew 6:14-15 teaches forgiveness from God depends on forgiving others.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about the narrow gate in Matthew 7?
options: It leads to life and few find it
It leads to destruction and many enter
It is wider than the broad gate
questions.correctAnswer: It leads to life and few find it
questions.explanation: Matthew 7:13-14 contrasts the narrow gate leading to life and few finding it.

questions.question: Who did Jesus say would be known by their fruits?
questions.explanation: Matthew 7:15-20 teaches that false prophets are known by their fruits.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said that everyone who calls Him 'Lord' will enter the kingdom of heaven.
questions.explanation: Matthew 7:21 teaches not everyone saying 'Lord, Lord' will enter, but only those who do the will of the Father.

questions.question: What is the foundation of the wise man’s house in Jesus’ parable?
questions.explanation: Matthew 7:24-25 says the wise man built his house upon the rock, which withstood storms.

questions.question: In Matthew 8, who was the centurion that asked Jesus to heal his servant?
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:5-6 mentions a Roman centurion who sought healing for his servant.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus praised the centurion’s faith as being greater than any in Israel.
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:10 records Jesus marveling at the centurion's faith.

questions.question: What miracle did Jesus perform on the sea in Matthew 8?
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:26-27 describes Jesus calming the storm on the sea.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'And Jesus said unto him, If thou canst believe, all things are ______ to him that believeth.'
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:23 teaches that all things are possible to him that believeth.

questions.question: Who did Jesus raise from the dead in Matthew chapter 9?
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:18-25 recounts Jesus raising Jairus's daughter.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said the harvest is plenteous but the laborers are few.
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:37 states this about the need for laborers in the harvest.

questions.question: In Matthew 10, who did Jesus send out to preach and heal?
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:1-4 shows Jesus sending out the twelve.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus told his disciples to take gold, silver, or brass in their purses when sent out.
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:9-10 instructs the disciples not to take money or extra provisions.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about those who receive a prophet in the name of a prophet?
options: They will receive a prophet's reward
questions.correctAnswer: They will receive a prophet's reward
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:41 teaches that receiving a prophet in his name brings a prophet's reward.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy ______, and I will give you rest.'
questions.explanation: Matthew 11:28 invites those who are heavily laden to find rest in Jesus.

questions.question: Who did Jesus say is meek and lowly in heart and will find rest to their souls?
questions.explanation: Matthew 11:29 shows Jesus describing Himself as meek and lowly and inviting all to find rest in Him.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus rebuked the cities of Chorazin and Bethsaida for not repenting despite witnessing His miracles.
questions.explanation: Matthew 11:20-24 records Jesus denouncing these cities for their unbelief.

questions.question: What is the main theme of the Sermon on the Mount in Matthew chapters 5-7?
questions.explanation: Matthew 5-7 teaches the ethics of the kingdom and how followers should live.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus instructed to love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you.
questions.explanation: Matthew 5:44 commands love for enemies and prayer for persecutors.

questions.question: What sign did Jesus give to the Pharisees and Sadducees to prove His authority?
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:39-40 records Jesus saying no sign will be given except the sign of Jonah.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his ______; and all these things shall be added unto you.'
questions.explanation: Matthew 6:33 teaches to seek first the kingdom and His righteousness for provision.
